title: Nibble
extract:
In computing, a nibble (occasionally nybble or nyble to match the spelling of byte) is a four-bit aggregation, or half an octet. It is also known as half-byte or tetrade.
In a networking or telecommunication context, the nibble is often called a semi-octet, quadbit, or quartet.
A nibble has sixteen (24) possible values. A nibble can be represented by a single hexadecimal digit and called a hex digit.
extract_html: In computing, a nibble (occasionally nybble or nyble to match the spelling of byte) is a four-bit aggregation, or half an octet. It is also known as half-byte or tetrade. In a networking or telecommunication context, the nibble is often called a semi-octet, quadbit, or quartet. A nibble has sixteen (24) possible values. A nibble can be represented by a single hexadecimal digit and called a hex digit.
